reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am making this post for my guild as well as several other frustrated players on the forums that have been deprived a voice. My hours are not high but many of them were not logged to steam. Consider this a shared experience based on what I have not only experienced directly but witnessed many other players experiencing. The unhelpful votes at the top are most likely going to pile up as the griefer guild and admins find this post. Just look at its contents and decide for yourself.

Don't get this game. It might look ok at first but the melee combat is roughly based on circling around the opponent repeatedly and smacking them in the rear quarters then rinse repeat. The diversity is mostly just reskin of the same character types.

In addition, PVE is full of griefers which we as well as several other groups on the server were suffering from due to their use of exploits and/or hacks to grief while in PVE. They would hack into bases and destroy generators/shields/etc of every other player that wasn't from their little group. The server in question was EU 9 and the players in question do not attempt to hide their actions even on the forums admitting to it. That is the treatment new players were given once they had set up a protected base that should be protected from destruction. We had plenty of wood for 5+ days in the generator but exploits were used against us and basically every other player on this server. Due to the fact the moons are connected it means other servers were effected as well.

What happened when we tried to bring this to admin attention via email and steam correspondence? We were blocked and the players are still doing exploits and destroying peoples protected pve structures to this day.
Wow. Talk about -fantastic- moderation.

Alot of people would say to move to a new server however in this game that would require starting over and this player seems to do this kind of thing on multiple servers and/or moons so that wouldn't really help. If admin action were taken, like it should have been, the problem would be solved.

Currently, expect to lose your stuff to griefers even in PVE and expect the admins to do nothing about it.

You might ask WHY it is that noone has done anything about *names omitted due to political red tape in steam TOS*?

By my research of simply looking at publically available shared friends lists and the fact that I was ignored by the admin as are their griefing posts on the forums.. I'd say they know each other. There you have it. Nepotism. It is the only rational explanation I was able to come up with to explain the ultimately either lazy or malicious lack of action.

A player that uses hacks and/or exploits to glitch into peoples PVE bases and destroy everything including chests and spends 90% of their time bragging in global chat that they are on their train" of destruction then also brags on the forums will get away with it due to poor support for this game.

The game wasn't really anything to write home about before the fact that exploiting griefers can destroy your chests even in PVE game modes and force your entire guild to start over on a new server that may suffer the same problem.
The game looks somewhat flashy but there really isn't anything to do for a sandbox and the building and gameplay are rather limited and poorly balanced. A similar game that is in development that might need support is Planet Explorers. Really
date:
there are several similar games with better support if you toss a stone in a random direction.

It is grindy and it feels grindy.
Things are a palette swap if they are any different.
No cheat protection that I can discern so enjoy the large amount of hackers/exploiters in pvp OR pve.
The graphics really aren't that great and the cartoon polish doesn't fix it.
The combat feels kind of basic.
Large amount of unnecessary resources which get dropped even in pve which require you to put it in a chest at your protected base and log on frequently otherwise even in pve other players can and will destroy all your things and get rid of all your belongings if you choose to not carry them around into dangerous areas. Even if you do keep your base protected by filling the generator some players will exploit and destroy it anyway. Cements fact 1 that the game is grindy.
Building system uses very limited supply of polished yet uninspired structures.

There is no end game
recommended:
people complain about this constantly on the forums. Go check it. Our favorite griefers complain about this as well and had stated that they decided the endgame was griefing other players and use this as an excuse.

Without the griefers I'd say a 7/10 at best at this point especially when compared to other similar games.
With the griefers the game is unplayable unless you plan to deal with your friends and everyone losing their bases to some jerky griefers and have to rebuild every time you log onto the servers. 5 or 6/10 at that point at best. I would like you to simply look at the number of negative vs positive reviews at the time of writing. 500 vs 1500. That is not a good satisfaction rate by any stretch of the imagination. This game might still sound good to you but I request you support one of the other similar games with a friendly community and people who care.

I would consider changing this review if I am given evidence that action is being taken against such players who grief in PVE or hack. I have screenshotted it and am prepared to post it to various other popular websites if it is removed or swept under the rug as I am sure will happen. If this happens I have the resources to go straight to the higherups at steam who will be curious as to why negative opinions of the game are being censored.
---------------------------------

TLDR;
Even if you are planning to play this game
hoursPlayed: I humbly ask that you rate this helpful so that people can at least go into the game knowing about the inner workings and happenings which may ruin their and their friends experiences and so that people know at the very least to avoid EU 9 due to its toxic community that is simply being enabled by the developers. Or avoid the game entirely because you can expect no support by the mods or admins."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Landed on an alien planet with a knife (now you get a club) and a multitool.  Only hint I got was get wood and fossils to make an armory (they have added a great tutorial that gives you exp and mats as you do basic tasks now).  Saw a giant flying alien bug and poked it with my knife, it expolded with a squish sound.  Repeated several times to hear the squish sound.  Accidentally ran into a bug that made me make a squish sound.

Made an armory and got a rusty gun and killed the bug that squished me.

Found a cave but there was a big pit in it.  The monsters chased me to the edge of the pit.  I fell in.  Second time I built a bridge over the pit and stood there pointing and laughing at the stupid monsters.  Monsters destroyed the bridge while I was standing on it.  They pointed and laughed as I fell to my death again.

This game is a blast!  It has survival elements, but no so hard core that you have to count how many M&Ms you have left in your pocket before you die.  It also has RPG elements where you can upgrade some skills (active and passive) and get new jobs that have a new set of skills with them. And you can build.  Building is fairly simpled but lots of fun.  You can also make a variety of weapons, armor and vehicles...like monocyle, jetpacks, tanks and jets.

You will die...you will laugh...and you will die some more while you learn.  The folks playing are helpful and fun.  This game is more than worth the money right now and is being patched frequently.

My best advice is to build a little base as soon as you get a shield generator blueprint.  Use it to store your extra mats so if you die you don't loose much.  You DO NOT drop your armor, ammo, or weapons when you die, just a percentage of your mats on hand.  You can also train a skill up to reduce how much you drop.

There are PK gankers of course, but there are anti-PKers as well that tend to balance it out.  You will get PKed.  The best thing to do is Don't Panic!  You are much more likely to survive if you keep your head and fight back.  Or run around some cover and pop and invis stim and run away.

Updated a bit.  There has been much patching and improving recently.  The game is better than ever.  The player base has grown after a recent free weekend.  There is so much to do in this game you shouldn't get bored.

Yes it can be a big grindy at times as some people have asked.  I don't find it bothersome.  You can have about 8 different jobs, which are like classes.  You can level each one seperatly or just focus on one.   Each comes with benefits.  I don't find lvling up other jobs that hard as I gather mats while I level.  You can hot swap any job at any time just in your inventory screen and any passives that you train remain no matter what job you have active.

Openworld, scifi style sandbox survival and building.  Try it!  You just might like it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

JANUARY REVIEW.
Loving this game so far, community is great. Most people tend to cooperate and explore with each other and disregard PVP. The potential is very very great in this game, I personally love it. The building, resources. Visuals are stunning. 10/10. The other negative reviews probably are just on the wrong servers and doing the wrong things. I'm having a very smooth time and so far there are no game killing bugs as of now. Respawning is designated with a craftable item and putting away resources is also achieved by making an item. Both that are very easy and cheap to make. See you in game!

Update: After an extensive amount of gameplay I quickly grew tired of it, I constantly stuck with the game hoping that an update will fix lag issues and after some few updates it did, but what got me was the leveling and crafting. Grinding was like a Job, you are forced to do it or you won't get anywhere. I'm talking in the sense that building a decent base will take almost half a REAL life day. Then the amount it takes to actually make the item takes away almost half of your resources you spent grinding for about 30 minutes. I am sad to say that I have left this game, it has potential yes it does but the image it's creating now is not the image I saw in my head when I saw this game on greenlight. I expected Borderlands/Minecraft/Terraria. Crazy adventures and fast paced action with some nice base building that is easy and fast. Maybe next time I'll come back to this game but for now it's out of my To Play List.

JUNE REVIEW
So I just took a look at the summer trailer and it still displays so much misleading and flashy visuals that can instantly capture a person who takes a big interest in suvival open world games such as me.

Definitely not Open World, It's just one piece of a huge land with only mobs and resources laying about with a few dungeons, nothing to interact with, just a barren wasteland. The combat is a looping cycle of meleeing and backing off, or with guns it's just unloading bullets on the mobs.Jetpacks take years to make, the fuel it uses is also a pain to get. PVP is still laggy and somewhat broken. Monocycles don't go as fast as you really think they do. Building the claim" in this trailer would take IRL days to make considering all the resource farming you'd have to do. Still waiting for that lovely overhaul to resource gathering and actual things to do in the game rather than just kill mobs

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before I review, I do want to mention, this is essentially a BRAND NEW GAME as the Reborn update has dropped.  It's radically different from what the game was, so in my opinion most of the reviews prior to mine are no longer accurate.

I'll keep it short.  This is one of the most unique games I've ever played, it's essentially a dedicated-server based online RPG with some slight survival influences, extensive base building, fun sci-fi, and an awesome resource centric progression system.  It's very much like starbound in this fact.

Pros:

-You can travel to other planets as you level up, they rotate on a loop about 3 planets per tier so it never seems to get boring.
-Very diverse crafting system
-Persistent vehicle like Dune Buggies, tanks, jets, etc.  Prepare yourself for epic endgame battles over territory.
-Territory system!  You can conque grids and form mini kingdoms on each individual planet having separate grids.
-Class system - allows you to specialize or diversify, this game is all about choice
-This game is very fun with friends
-Complex PvP and raiding system.  Guys can't just show up with pickaxes and raid your base like some survivals
-It's a very playable Alpha game, DEFINITELY worth it for the price
-PvP is balanced, gear is a factor but a dude with a t1 pistol can very realistically challenge a top tier player

Cons:

-This could be a pro or a meh" depending on your mindset
hoursPlayed:
but a very rewarding a fun grind especially if you're with friends
-Get ready to break your mouse with semi-autos as you crush your LMB!  Haha!

Meh:

-Community

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played this game for around 270 hours, also reached the endgame long time ago. Let's sum it up:
PROS
-nice graphics
-the idea of multiple planets and moons with different hazard conditions
-official servers divided on PvE and PvP
-the game has a lot of potential
-lots of weapons to choose from (also balanced)
-many different resources to get
-great community (at least on EUR PvE server, which i played on)
CONS
-resources' and monsters' grindfest to the point of extreme boredom
-more than half of all planets (except homeworlds) look similar or identical
-only around 11-12 type of monsters
-building anything more complicated than a simple cube is frustrating
-there is a single player mode, but use it only for a tutorial to learn basic things - advancement is impossible there (unless You play 1000 hours) because of the way resource nodes spawn (multi is fine)

And the last, most important one - LITTLE TO NO UPDATES SINCE HALF A YEAR! There were some small patches, that brought new hats (hooray...) and a few changes in game rules on official servers, but there's a complete lack of new content since October and no major bugs were fixed throughout those few months. The devs' support and contact is also greatly lacking.

Would i recommend this game? Right now - no. As i mentioned - great potential, but squashed by people with no heart to finish their product.
If so, then why did I play it for so long? I guess I just like to finish things, also other people on the server made it more fun to play.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game is ruled by high level players.  Being there is 0 risk to them they spend most of their time taxing (as in they gain a percentage of all the resources you farm) and killing low level players and destroying anything they want whenever they're bored.  You can't do anything to stop them but watch what you have built be destroyed and you have start over.  Luckily your levels and equipment don't reset on death, but you'll lose most your resources and the people who killed you can take the rest.  At least with other survival games, the risk to them is bigger the more they have.  So you're not always constantly attacked.

The combat is also boring.  You have several jobs to try to make the game look like there is a reason to keep grinding.  The jobs offer new passive skills and active skills to use, but don't offer any gameplay differences.  They are there strictly to drain your time.  Because when you start a new job you start with level 0 stats.  Even with your more powerful gear you'll have to go through the same grind as when you first started.  You'll have to do this on all the jobs if you want all the percs.  But unlike a MMO where the classes/jobs would offer unique gameplay, Grav offers no such thing and it's strictly there as a time sink.

And all the monsters of the world are pretty samey as well.  Even as you gain new levels and go to new places you'll fight the same monster over and over.  And most monsters even of different kinds have the same attacks.  Most have some sort of spit attack and those that don't have a small AoE.  That's it for diversity.  Speaking of the worlds.  They’re pretty small.  Those big worlds they show in the trailer?  That’s about the size of em.  Very small.

So there you have it.  Grav, a game where you get tortured and picked on by the few high levels, while grinding against the same boring monsters, farming the same resources, so that one day you can be a high level to pick on the low level guys as well, because there is no endgame besides that.

It really isn’t worth your time, this game has nowhere to progress.  A cross between a survival game and an MMO and not very good at either.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Asked a question, got an reply from a dev within 3 hours. 11/10

Now all jokes aside, this game has potential. It seems like combination of Rust and your average RPG, combined in a Multiplayer experience--don't get this confused with an MMO experience. The world looks amazing right now, but what else would you expect from a UnrealEngine game. The base game seems to be a level grind and resource grind to build your house/town/city!? Probably like you, I thought the video/pictures were misleading--like usual, but it's NOT, the game actually looks that good. However, you will encounter some bugs from time to time.

EDIT:
After playing for 25+ hours, the GUI is no longer complicated, and you'll know what to do and how to get it!

Pros:
-Decent EA game, with decent content for now.
-Really good looking.
-Tons and tons to explore.
-Base building.

Cons:
-Bad GUI.
-Hard to understand what to do and how to get for instance a Generator.
-Servers are really really laggy, pretty much all of them.
-No Linux Dedi Server support, yet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is tons of fun, devs are active they reply on steam forums and keep on patching bugs.

The game has vibrant colors. Imagine Rust and Planet Explorers had a baby and named it GRAV.

I have played 5 hours straight, was killed in PvP once, owned by flying bugs, made friends, built a base with them, explored caves. The game has tons of potential, but requires your patience, I believe as more players join, more servers will come up, creating another succesful survival game, but this time with a different feel to it!

Totally recommend the game for those who understand what Early Access Games with tons of potential require.

Edit 1: after playing even more, I've noticed some bugs but they never ruined the fun! the only issue is the lag at times, but the devs are working on it!

Edit2: crowded servers tend to lag a bit more than servers with 8-16 people on is what I noticed from trying out different servers. The game is enjoyable in less crowded servers at current state.

Edit3: as of Patch 4, the lag has been reduced and server performance really improved. Looking forward to future updates.

Edit4: as of the 18th of January, Patch 7 is released, more improvements (CPU/GPU-wise) in bay as well as further graphical enhancements. see the announcments for further info.

I don't know anymore. Still positive though.

21st of May 2016: I miss GRAV </3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all,note that GRAV doesn't have the 'survival' element in it.The RPG element is the most dominant one in this game.You don't have 'hunger' 'thirst' bar like those true survival games.GRAV is a hybrid between TPS,open world,and RPG.

Pros :
+ Beautiful graphics ! Like PlanetSide 2,some places can make quite a scenery and I love it ! Just remember to turn Post Processing ON.
+ Cool vehicles designs with a wide range of variety,from wingsuits to fighter jets,each with its upgraded version that consume less fuel and have more speed.
+ Humor element included.Dancing Gangnam Style beside a campfire with a dubstep music will replenish your health and stamina.You can also poop anywhere you want.
+ Fun building.Bases are some kind of your personal trophy,and designing it is a lot of fun,especially preparing your base to punish griefers.
+ Your character can do a lot of emotions,it decreases the crude feeling of the game.For example,you can wave,you can clap,you can vomit,you can say hi,you can salute,etc.
+ Very friendly and supportive community.They will help you level up,they will help you farm,they will give you high level weapons and multitools,they will guide you,and some of them will give you a ride to certain places if you don't have a vehicle yet.(Asia 01 server)
+ Very active and communicative devs that will help you with any kind of in-game issue
+ New players won't suffer from high level players,since there's some kind of protection policy on Asia 01 server.High level players who kill new players will get punished by the level 300 guy.Big shoutout to Klipwc for the great guide and his support for new players.

Cons :
- Game performance is dreadful.You will experience crashes mid-game,connection interruptions (ur character blinks around the map),fps spikes,ping spikes,endless loading screen,game suddenly not responding after loading,and sometimes,you will have to wait around 25 minutes after loading for the map around you to load.During this wait time,the map around you will refresh constantly and you will get 5 to 20 seconds freeze each time you try to move.The problem is from the game itself.High end gaming PCs won't fix this.
- Spotlights will drop your fps to 5-10 if you fly near them,despite your strong PC spec
- Very few players(2-10 players each server).This is due to the high system requirements and the current state of the game.
- Needs a lot of time to farm.The resources you get from the sources are so low that it makes the majority of time you will spend in the game is for farming.
- Monster spawning system still require a lot of work.Monsters still spawn behind you,on top of you,or sometimes doesn't spawn at all even if I already waited for 15 minutes.Imagine high level bosses spawn on top of your head.
- If a lot of people play this game,this game will not be ready for 32 players on each server.I'm sure it will increase the loading time,and your bases will get destroyed everyday.People will attack each other for the resources,since it will take a long time to farm,and they will also try to get the 100 kill hat trophy.
- You will lose 90% of your resource when you die (50% if you maxed your Astronaut skill).As I said before,this game is not ready for 32 players.Imagine 32 hostile players attack each other for resources and no high level player protect the new players.It will be a total chaos.Bases will be destroyed easily by the players that already has rocket launchers or tanks.Losing 90% of resource is a pretty ridiculous system and it's one of the biggest factor that make this game isn't ready for 32 players.
- Classic RPG mentality problem.Some high level players are very proud of their bases,vehicles,weapons,etc.They show off their things everyday to the new players and tell them to do stupid things for their amusement.
-Griefers alert.Griefers are extremely annoying in this game and one of them are very active going around the servers to troll.They will destroy your bases,change your signs,steal your resources,etc.All experienced players are currently hunting griefers even though it's very hard to find and punish them,since they always move from server to server.Beware for M.F Thatherson.He is the infamous griefer that goes around the servers.
- New player spawn point system is ridiculous.There is a chance for you to spawn inside hostile base even though it's your first time playing.Auto turrets will shred new players that're the victim of this spawning system.I was forced to leave my old base because I accidentaly built it on the noob spawn point.
- You need 16 gigs of RAM if you want to run your own server,and at least 8 gigs of RAM to play with maximum settings.This requirement really shows that this game isn't optimized well and perform horribly.Note that not all country has cheap access to computer thingies.
- New guns only means new colors.No new designs from each guns.There's only 1 design for pistol,1 design for shotgun,1 design for SMG,and 1 design for Assault Rifle.The melee already has a lot of designs though.
- No headshot hitbox,makes combat system very boring and requires a long time.Imagine holding LMB/clicking LMB multiple times for hours on each cave with no variation at all.
- No new weapon sounds.All weapons have the same sound,except SMG and shotgun.
- Boring and dreadful soundtrack,except the campfire dubstep music.
- Building bases maybe fun but the building system is still not perfect.It's pretty complicated and made a lot of my friends frustrated.
- Bases lack of decorations.They should add chairs,tables,or any other decorations that has actual effect on the game.For example,a daily EXP/resource buff if we use certain furnitures.Today,all bases are only filled with crafting stations,composter,stargates,and their defense systems,which make the bases look horribly empty.

Suggestions
1.Fix the performance of the game ASAP.The game's performance today is extremely horrible.It's worse than horrible.There's no word to describe it.It's just a total mess.Imagine losing 90% of your resources only because you disconnected by the game's ping spikes and the game killed you with CDT_ForcedSuicide"
2.Increase the farming speed.Harvest pets should give twice resources and each resource points should have more resources available.Farming 20 woods from each tree while you need thousands to build a base and craft things is ridiculous.
3.Ban griefers.I know it's PvP and griefing is technically not an illegal thing.But remember that it hurts the player base because common sane people hate and avoid games with griefers.Griefers are trollers.They are people who have questionable sanity and mentality
date: that entertain themselves by making other people angry through internet because they feel invincible since people can't do anything to them.\n4.Find permanent teammates.With today's rate of farming
recommended: you need at least 1 permanent teammate.The more the merrier.Teammates will decrease the time needed to build a base and craft things
hoursPlayed: because you can easily trade resources through public/FoF only storage bin.\n5.Play at the most crowded server in your region.More high level guys means more support for new players.Just be patient when they're showing off
voteText:
and refuse when they told you to do stupid things for their amusement.
6.Read Klipwc's guide on how to make grief-proof base.There is a way to completely prevent griefers from destroying your base

Overall

votesTotal: but opening the server for 32 players with this current state of the game is ridiculous.If they want to open it for 32 players

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR: Should have returned this game instead of looking for the good in it. Does not match advertisement or expectations. Several environments in preview videos do not exist. Previews suggest gameplay that is not present in current stage of development. Gameplay is exceedingly simplistic grinding for numbers. Game is in alpha stages with resource, stability, and memory leak issues. Potential exists, but no amount of quantity makes up for the lack of quality.

What follows is a section by section commentary on the about this game" bullet points.

Endless Worlds - Planets are not procedurally generated
date: counter to advertisement. All planets have a static map. Exoplanets rotate every 3 hours
recommended: making some game objects virtually useless. Exoplanets are often either small enough or with rough terrain to render land vehicles near useless. Flying vehicles feature six axis movement but no horizon or flight hud and no tuneable flight controls: expect to roll and tumble wildly for your first dozen flights. Glide suit and jetpack do not work together
hoursPlayed: you must alternate using one and the other to remain in the air.\n\nGorgeous Visuals - While GRAV can be rather pretty
voteText: the visuals are unoptimised. The game itself consumes an inordinate amount of system RAM (4gb+) and leaks memory (consumed 7gb system ram after a few hours). Reducing texture LOD reduces visual quality far faster than system load. I frequently experienced terrible artifacting near the beach area
helpfulPercent: with each patch to the game slightly altering the location and severity of the artifacting.\n\nFrenzied Combat - Circle strafe while tapping backwards and holding the fire button for up to a minute per enemy. Twelve different palatte swapping enemies advance with the same mindless behavior and ignore collision with most player placed objects
votesHelpful: but halt and become confused when the player jumps onto slightly elevated or out of the way platforms. Enemy melee attacks damage the player for ~50% of health in early game and nearly nothing late game. Rare enemies use mild but irritating camera shake inducing ranged attacks alternating with AoE ground pounds and regular melee. One mob has a pushback that deals significant damage if you are pushed into a wall. "Boss" type enemies are ~3x the size with ~4x the health and ~2x the XP. Using on-tier equipment against equal-level mobs
votesTotal: players damage enemies for ~1% of health using automatic weapons: expect to carry 10
votesFunny: 000 rounds of ammunition and use 75-150 rounds per mob. Grind away for hours as XP gain sharply falls toward 10 when fighting mobs below your level and damage sharply falls toward 1 when fighting mobs above your level. Enjoy becoming stuck on random terrain or ambushed by sudden respawns from behind and dropping 50-90% of your loot.\n\nPlayer vs Player - No easily managed friends list: become friends with people by giving them the numeric passcode to your team's private chat and granting them entry to all your buildings and belongings. No method to determine who is currently using that passcode. Changing your individual passcode does not automatically update your buildings or chests. No such thing as a list of foes for tracking your enemies. No such thing as a neutral list
commentsCount: anyone who isn't your friend is your enemy. Impossible to raid other players bases unless they contain one of two different placeable objects.\n\nPlay With Friends - Most of my friends were bored within 10 hours. Many quit after 60. Due to the nature of the friend passcode
column16:
it is very difficult to make friends for fear of major theft. System resource requirement is prohibitive to running a Solo or local server.

Powerful Base Construction - Build cube shaped rooms to make cube shaped bases. No method to control which walls are removed or preserved when building an adjoining room. No method to add walls back to a room after walls have been removed. Destroy the entire room and try again. Sometimes this requires you to destroy an entire quarter of a base and try again. Don't bother trying to build balconies around your base. Turret damage is overpowered at low levels and near worthless at upper levels.

Extensive Crafting - There are ~123 different crafting materials
column17: but the bulk of work is done by 10. The rest are one-off items for specific recipes you may use only once or never at all. You will craft an AR and an SMG because the AR has the best DPS without rapid clicking and the SMG ammo drops are plentiful enough to make it a viable secondary. All other ammunition is a waste of inventory space. By the time you have an automatic weapon
column18: melee is a waste of time and effort. Equipment progresses linearly while costs increase somewhat exponentially. Defensive equipment is the primary progression
column19: but variation is lacking. At least one set of equipment is a palette swap. Defending against an environmental hazard often means using equipment well below the area's difficulty. There is no method to sort
column20: filter
column21: or easily manage your inventory or your storage bins.\n\nDynamic Environmental Events - Enemies spawn more frequently at night. Night is very dark and flashlights are craftable temporary accessories. Large numbers of a single enemy type will spawn occasionally as an "event". I have never seen flowers bloom as part of the day/night cycle as advertised. I have never seen meteors fall across the terrain as advertised
column22: let alone regular rain. Sometimes there is fog
column23: and that's about it.\n\nProcedurally Generated Dungeons - Dungeons are procedurally generated from about sixteen different component rooms
column24: but component rooms are static
column25: uninteresting tunnels
column26: often accompanied by invisible clip walls and enemy pathing issues. The same four direct harvestable resources are available on all planets. Three resources require a placeable object to create/harvest. Four resources are exoplanet specific
column27: making them slightly harder to get. Each "level" of exoplanet has an "uncommon" variation of each of these resources
column28: but you'll soon find yourself throwing out stacks and stacks of the uncommons once you've used them for their one purpose. Sometimes there is a pit in the caves or the procedural generation makes a gap to empty space; I guess those are the advertised environmental obstacles.\n\nHostile Environments - Warping to a planet with a hostile environment without the appropriate equipment begins a countdown. When the countdown is over
column29: you lose 5% of your max health every "tick". All water off the home planet is damaging. That's about it.\n\nRoadmap - Several of these features are already or partially implemented. This is not a good track of coming features or completed features."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, what to say... From the few videos you see you really want to get it, at least that happened to me. Is it fun? Yeah, but it won't last long.
I felt attracted to the game mainly because of the looks of it and the fact that it was a survival/crafting game.

:: SURVIVAL ::
-The only survival aspect if you play singleplayer (hosting your own server to play alone in it) is the fact that you have that hunger bar, that, if you just farm for blueprints, exp, and materials from mobs you'll get plenty. Nothing more, you won't even see it, like, NEVER, going down to half.
-In multiplayer the survival aspect comes from trying to survive from other players, if you are on a pvp server ofc.

:: ENEMIES ::
Little variety. You have slimes, something that resembles a really fat bee, a tick/louse thing that barks, a blue humanoid alien that you really don't want near you and another mob that's called Day killer and Night killer (depends on the time of the day) that runs fast and wants to kill you. The only thing that change with this mobs is that they are elemental based (Icy slime or blaze slime f.e.). Can't remember if you have more enemies.

:: CRAFTING ::
Don't, just DON'T buy this if you assume the crafting system will be like Minecraft or Don't Starve. You can craft very few things at the beginning, and if you want more, you need to kill everything on sight hoping to get a blueprint. This is easier if the mob or boss you are killing has a few levels more than you (1 or 2). The red crates that drop stuff just gives you materials, not blueprints. A thing devs might add to the crates, at least basic bp's.

:: WEAPONS ::
You have the basic item, and the same with an elemental damage type to craft (fire, ice, poison, electric, and maybe one more). U start with a hunting knife, then you might get a club, a wooden sword, pistols, rifles, and even a shotgun.
Firing weapons sux, really low dmg even with the Pet that buff that. I used a wooden sword, and a wooden sword with fire damage until lvl 14. Remember, if you don't get a blueprint from monster drops, you are gonna have a bad time...

The mining tool" that you use to get ores
recommended: crystals and stuff has like 10 or more upgraded versions to craft (Mark I
hoursPlayed: Mark II
voteText: Mark III
helpfulPercent: etc.). I crafted the Mark VIII and didn't even noticed a change. Maybe it mined a bit faster
votesHelpful:
but the same numbers of mats where being mined (1).

:: The World ::
Small if you ask me. Even more small if u join a server with lots of ppl. It has a central island
votesTotal: and 1 or 2 more of high lvl mobs and dungeons (from 14 to 29 from what i saw).\nCan't remember if the stuff i read before buying the game said anything about being able to explore other worlds but you can't here
votesFunny:
not now at least. Remember it's an EA.

:: FINAL NOTES ::
If you like the general idea of the game (watch gameplays) and want to buy it now before it's fully finished (and more expensive maybe)
commentsCount: buy it.\nIf not
column16: don't do it. I bought it in 11/01/2015 and today (14/01/2015) am ready to say that maybe when finished
column17: it will be a fun game to play. Not now
column18: but maybe someday.\n\nI really don't know what more to say. I liked the game the time i played it. I still like it
column19: and i think this has much more to offer.\nRight now devs are trying to reduce the lag on their servers

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Foreword

My initial review was Negative. The game was extremely buggy, laggy, bad performance and there was no single player ( multiplayer server you could play alone but it required a lot of resources ).

Bear in mind that we can only make first impressions / review of the game based on what is released" or presented to us. Game was in terrible state but it was a rough diamond. That being said
date: I couldn't just blindly recommend buying this game because of moral issues. There were more stable ALPHA's out there that you could actually play and enjoy the little content they had.\nAdd to that the fact that "we" as gamers can't trust the "promises" of the developers. How many times we have been robbed silly by blindly believing "this game has a potential" ? I can name a few games : Starforge and Legend Of Aethereus. Promises weren't delivered
recommended:
production stopped and money was never seen again. Hence I can't justify the reviews that are protecting the game rather than consumer. If you like your ♥♥♥ handed over to you then so be it. Just don't involve other people money.

-------------------------------------------------------
Review

After couple of months of patching and rapid development ( seems like the Dev's are working hard
hoursPlayed: gotta give them credit for that ) the game is finally playable for me. It runs around 50 FPS in 1080p
voteText:
there are slow downs here and there but nothing really major.
It seems like they have improved performance and eliminated some of the bugs / lag issues I was having.

The biggest change for me was the addition of the Single Player ( I don't have to do port forwarding now or do anything in that matter
helpfulPercent: just one click of a button and a long loading screen ).\n\nIt seems like they have added a lot of new content and balanced the game as well. That being the case
votesHelpful: monster spawns are bad and can get you killed if you are not on your toes. Guns feel underpowered and there is this Level system for everything which to me is a bit stupid. It reminds me of Borderlands ( higher level mobs are almost impossible to kill when low level and gear ). I was never a fan of such concept but it's playable regardless whether I like it or not. Player has to adapt accordingly.\nTo the game defense I can add that while enemy A.I can be dumb
votesTotal: game is action based and requires manual aiming
votesFunny: dodging and melee combos. Which feels and sounds great! I hope the will refine what they have here.\n\nAs for the crafting and harvesting
commentsCount: I had no issues there as it gets progressively easier. If you are upgrading your tools that is. Once you get through initial grind ( in the beginning ) then player can focus on combat and exploration.\n\nThere are randomly generated dungeons which offer little rewards ( blueprints
column16:
resources etc. ) but are worth exploring regardless.

Sadly there is no terra forming so all of the resources are on the surface and as far as I know I can't blow trees/ground up. I can live with that tho...

Overall it is a game that I have high hopes for and I can safely say that finally it's worth current price ( 14.99 ).
One thing HAS to be said. As they upload new patches they tend to wipe the servers. Which results in loss of saves/worlds. I wish they can overcome that in the future so character data at least stays unchanged.

If you like sandbox experiences with really fun combat and exploration then this game might be for you. If you have friends then it's even better.

Peace."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really can't wait for future updates this game is really fun and already has alot to it.

So far i've found a pretty active public server with lots of people on it.
All the servers have their own home planet but once you head to a other planet by building a stargate, all the servers ( about 12 at the moment ) are on common ground.

You have the possibility to create building blocks with ladders, doorways, closed rooms, open rooms, teleportal rooms, glass rooms, shields, gun turrets, material factories, armories, spawn uplink points, stargates and alot more. I'm sure ALOT is going to be added in the future.
These buildings can all be protected from outsiders or be set to public if you wish to share with others

The game is heavily material grind and PvE based wich in my opinion is great cause you feel that you have progression but ofcourse that differs for others.
That said PvP is also a big part of this game. At the moment when you kill other players you can loot all their resources if they aren't able to pick it up within 15 minutes. The gear will stay after the resources are picked up so you won't be completely useless after you've been killed.

Combat takes abit getting used to i'm hoping to see future improvements since the animation when swinging your melee just swings your arm rather then seeing your body put weight into the swing.
Would also love to see more diversity in melee weapons as the begin we're able to make a 'club' while the rest of the melee weapons are all knifes ( wich look pretty badass )

For guns there is a good diversity from what i've seen. Assault rifles, pistols and shotguns at the moment.
Combat with those also needs improvement since now whenever you shoot you always have to be zoomed in wich is quite annoying since you cant really see what's going on around you and walk into mobs or against walls wich gets me killed most of the time.

As for teams we're able to set a 'FoF' up at the moment that way you can share structures, portals and other stuff with your buddies.

I've had tons of fun so far and will continue playing this. Already been in a conflict with other players where i got ganked on the moon and retaliated by seeking sweet revenge upon their base !

Bring it on players !

Oh and if you don't like PvP you can always choose a PvE server :)

I hope this review gave you enough information, if you have any questions feel free to ask.
I always keep steam broadcasting on for everyone so if u want to see gameplay footage you can always check it out too !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game might be one of the best games on early access, I would recommend this to anyone who likes survival games as it's not like the other generic survival games you'll see here, no, this one is special.
This one has a bigger potential than my ♥♥♥♥, literally! I've got this game yesterday and I have already spent 7 hours playing it and it actually got me off my Counter Strike - Global Offensive addiction which is pretty impressive considering I haven't tried a different game for months, but let's get to the point:
What this game has:
-Great graphics (for an early access)
-No pay to win
-Great combat system (atleast in my opinion)
-Very fun to play, especially with friends
-Great crafting system (Basically, you gotta get blueprints to get certain items which keeps the pump to play, I've been trying to get this cool motorcycle at the picutre for my entire playtime so far)
-Regular content update
Now this is a list of what this game has to fix (keep in note that it's in alpha/prealpha so I suppose this list will get fixed after my review has been posted):
-Optimization
-Single Player
-Lag fixes
-Add an option to crouch
-Implementing more ideas into the game (as I've mentiond it's still in early access and I'm 100% sure the developers will add great content to it)
In my opinion this game is fun for whoever likes survival games as it might be a bit repetitive it's not as boring as the other generic survival games which wont be fun to play after 1 hour of playing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For the Price of a Movie ticket and a soda I got a little over 3 hours of entertainment and overall I enjoyed my play of the game and look forward to what features and advances the game will add as it progresses
(EDIT: I should perhaps specify that I purchased the game while it was on sale during it's being launched on Steam, the standard price of the game is of course more)

GRAV is a crafting/resource/survival game...one of many that have sprung up from the success of Minecraft and DayZ
What I find attractive about GRAV is the Sci-fi setting, I'm not really into the swords and zombies direction most survival games take (just a personal preference)

The game is currently in Alpha and at this stage is more a proof of concept, while future features and functionality will most likely be patched in as the game goes through it's journey from Alpha to Beta and finally to RELEASE, this is what we can expect from the core experience

As of now I had no trouble running the game, nor any trouble finding a server
While at the time of this writing there is not yet a singleplayer/offline mode, this I expect will be added in the future
For now it was best for me to play on a public server, especially since there is really not much to this game except the bare bones functions and interacting with other players and what they had built gave me a jump start on the begining of the game and gave me something else to do beside the few functions available at this time
There are most certainly bugs and glitches and wonky controls, but since this is an Alpha I'm willing to set aside these flaws with the assumption that most if not all will be addressed at a later date
What I'll be focusing on is what the core elements of the game are like as of now

-IMPRESSIONS-
You spawn in the wilderness, most likely near other players which makes resource gathering a bit of a hike...since you'll have to travel to find the resource nodes you'll need to craft your items
You have only a knife and a Multitool at start, and you can make your way just fine with those alone, though stronger enemies and dungeons might require stocking up on better gear
You'll fight weird aliens and gather resources to build a home base or try your luck in one of the leveled dungeon instances that spawn throughout the world
You'll explore weird alien landscapes where the laws of physics seem to bend if not break, with rocky deserts and lush yellow forests, from floating rocks to poison seas, from abandoned structures to crashed spacecraft
All randomly generated so each trip over the mountain offers a chance at something new

-CRAFTING-
While I played I found only 5 nodes to gather resources
Trees = Wood
Piles of Bone = Fossils
Shiny Rocks = Ore
Smoking Crater = Element X
Each node has a chance to drop a more refined or rare resource, but overall these are all you can expect to find as far as gathering/farming is concerned
You use these resources to craft buildings and crafting stations
As of now there is no way to un-build what you've built, but I'd expect this to change in the future
Crafting Stations are where you'll build your equipment and refine your resources, Upgrading your stations allows for access to more items
Enemies are currently the only way to gather new recipes and blueprints

-COMBAT-
Combat is real time and skill based, you'll have to time your swings and stay outside of the enemies range of attack
You'll gain levels from killing enemies and each enemy has it's own level, so don't be surprised to see yourself die at the hands of a higher level enemy
Death is not perminent, in fact you don't even lose all your items, only a portion of your items are left at your corpse (and that portion can be reduced by spending skill points in the appropriate skill)
Your lost items will remain where you died and will be Loot Locked" for a period of time
date:
no one will be able to loot your corpse until the timer has expired

-SURVIVAL-
As of now you need only fear starvation
recommended: you'll start with a portion of food and if you craft a farm you can restock your food for your journey\nNight time is not the time for huddleing in some crude structure while waves of baddies swarm around you
hoursPlayed: the only thing to fear in the night is the lower visibility\nThe game does have night time monster swarms that spawn higher level monsters
voteText: but they are random and come every couple days or so
helpfulPercent:
they are posted on your HUD telling you what the spawn is and when it will arrive

-VISUALS-
I think the game is beautiful
votesHelpful: I'm a huge fan of bright colorful environments and stylized characters and monsters\nI enjoy the design direction the game has taken
votesTotal:
with a slightly Retro/Pulp sense for shapes and patterns...like stepping into a modern interpretation of the Weird Science comics I love

-AUDIO-
This is probably my least enjoyed portion of my experience
votesFunny: while I did enjoy the music a lot of the sound effects seemed "canned"...as if they were just there to fill a function temporarily
commentsCount: which since this is an Alpha just may be the case\n\nSo overall the game has only a little to offer at this stage in it's development
column16: but I'm hopeful more will be added as things are polished and programed\nSo if you're into games like Planet Explorers or Starbound and you want to support an independent developer while they try to make this game all it can be
column17:
then you could do a lot worse with your money than buying this game

Hope to have been of help
Tallow"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game crashed my PC
Gave me severe fps drops
Made me frusterated af when you are getting ganged ♥♥♥♥♥ by non stop spawning monsters
Left me in complete confusion as a level 0
Disconnected me from the server multiple times

BUT

I ♥♥♥♥ing love this game. As I spawned into the game having no idea what I was doing or where I was I was stunned by the almost dream like graphics. As night comes by I build a campfire and around 3-4 other level 0 noobies like myself gathered around and chatted. After one of us found the x button (the dance key) we all went ham. The stunning realization that this dope ♥♥♥ music was implemnted as the main way of healing in the game just adds to my respect of the creators. The amount of hype for 5 level 0 noobies was something I have never experienced before, we exchanged stories and went our seperate ways. As morning one of my fire buddies and I began to finish the objectives until around level 5 where it really started to get interesting. We started to get blueprints for vehicles, assault rifles, wing suits, and frog feet (<-- actually quite helpful). Campfire buddy and I have mics so we can enjoy our adventure togethor as we conquer dungeons, wreck n00bs, and pillage from the rich. I soon invited a friend to play with us, so campfire guy and I tp'ed to his world and proceed to waste all of our wood and fossils searching for this scruberino by shooting flares every 5 seconds, but eventually we found him and pillaged togethor once again. As you can see after only my first day of playing this game I have already logged 5 hours into this game.

Side Note: I was originally only going to play about an hour of this game and go back and play fallout 4 but this game just grabed my attention.

+Challenging as you must unlock more blueprints
+Levels
+Skills
+Dungeons

BUGS/CONS:
-Sometimes buildings will disappear after reloading your world (quit/disconect and rejoin)
-A.I. are incomplete and all are pet vendors as of now (People and robot A.I.)
-All A.I. seem to be able to No-Clip thru natural structures (Trees, Rocks, (etc.))
-Some resources (trees, ores, gems, (etc.) trees mostly tho) will sometimes also be clipped thru natural objects such as rocks.

Overall rate = 4.9/5 or 9.8/10
This game has a very strong potential outcome to be one of the best on steam (or atleast very close to minecraft equivalent) seeing as whats already here and it still only pre release.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I'm writing as of the current state of the game now, by date of its launch ( 8/1/2015 )

Even though I'm giving it a 'thumbs up' it's not recommemed for anybody aside from the people who label themselves as bug finders, as it's not playable to be enjoyable for the average consumer right now. The issue(s) that plague the game at the moment is lag, lots and lots of lag, to the point where it's unplayable to check out the other parts of the game to decide on its quality and whether it's good or bad, but from the parts I've played and managed to look into it is as follows..

The graphics are decent, with the art style being really colorful and good looking, same goes for the level design of the game with how nice the landscape looks, kind of reminds of No Man's Sky, but it definitely has its own unique fun look.

The controls are nice and responsive but a bit floaty/boaty, and the UI/Interface of the game are really basic, you can see that it's sort of a place holder. Crafting and building structures and objects/items are easy, but not that convenient/enjoyable with how basic the UI is at the moment. Also, there isn't much to do at the moment aside from crafting, building structures and items, exploring and killing monsters, there may be a lot more stuff to do but it's hard to tell right now, since there is no offline mode too (at the moment, not sure if it will come later on)

So yea, that's what I got from playing the game at the moment, with how massive the lag is right now. The game has great potential to be a lot of fun, looking at the videos, and getting a quick play session of it now. I don't recomemend it right now, but will definitely check the game constantly to check if it's an ok purchase or not, because I do have really high hopes for this one.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nReally enjoying this game. I find myself to be easily distracted due to the urge to explore and find new blueprints. Whether you're playing on your own, with friends, or with strangers, it's always a lot of fun. There's PVE and PVP servers to suit the experience you're wanting from the game as well as Official and Unoffical servers. Like I said, it's incredibly easy to become distracted in GRAV. I often find myself gathering resources, then spotting a dungeon and being drawn to the idea of killing mobs and finding them precious blueprints. GRAV  can  be a very unforgiving world, you'll have to watch your back whilst gathering, ensure there's enough wood in your generator to power your base and be very cautious on new planets you travel to. All in all, it's a fantastic game, despite some optimisation issues and bugs (remember people, this  is  an Early Access game run by an Indie Dev). With a recent major update and an enthusiastic and active dev team, this is a game that is sure to have a great future ahead of itself.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

With over a 160 hours on Grav as of the time this review was written. I did like to believe I can at least write a decent one.
I now clock over 400 hours as of build 20.

I have also written a guide for this game. Reading it will help you address the common annoyances people have with the game and also further influence your decision to get it.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=470854662
The review has had stuff added due to patch 19. Nothing was removed though.
This review has been re-written for build 20 due to the large amount of stuff and improvments added to the game. New players have a much easier time starting the game now due to the new damage curve, area level re-rolls and tutorial objectives.

Firstly, Grav is a sandbox open world, much like the other sandboxes on the market, you farm for resources, craft stuff, build bases and consume stuff to survive. It also belongs in the Sci-fi theme. The game does start out alittle boring, but once you get to around level 13 and make your first trip to the moon, the game becomes infinitely more fun then. I would suggest trying the game till this point before asking for a refund.

What sets this game apart from the others? Honestly I cant give a definite answer to this yet, and I am not gonna mention dancing. The game is still in development and community suggestions on stuff to be added to the game are conflicting. [ e.g building decay ] But still I am recommending it  based on several factors.

Pros:
Large maps
Game is gorgeous
They got the basics right
All basic resources are always useful
Great developers
Early access, updates come hard and fast, a new build every 2 weeks
Vehicles, jetpacks, wingsuits
Problems are solved fast
Building stuff is great if you are innovative

Cons:
8GB RAM requirement
Repetitive combat [or rather, non existent combat changes across levels]
Repetitive dungeons [see a few and you see it all]
No end game content [yet]
Insufficient playerbase
Resource farming requires some knowledge of where to get the fastest amount
Some lag is present
Griefers. Like almost every sandbox game? Griefers is a problem.
Building stuff is horrible if you dont excatly excell at doing stuff like that
Early access

So allow me to elaborate on the pros.
The maps are pretty large maps. The starter world for example is consisted of 2 - 3 Islands and each Island is serval kilometers wide. By basics I mean, combat, movement, UI and stuff are all decently done, there are some problems and room for improvements but updates are comming in fast for them.

The game is gorgeous? A picture says a thousand words.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=482330205

Comments saying the game did not ship with graphics shown in the store screenshots? Rubbish... They didnt turn on post proccessing, obviously it wont look the same.

All resources have a use for them, you wont, lets say... have no need for wood when you reach max level. Far from it, wood becomes more important than ever. This applies to every single resource. Something which you thought useless at the start, for example, I thought plasma was useless after I got off the moon, little did I know my vehicles and drill platfolm required plasma to run... until I got them that is.

The developers are great, they are actively talking with the community, suggestions made by the community have even been added into the experimental build within hours.

http://steamcommunity.com/app/332500/discussions/3/530645446313592491/

Proof that I aint just pulling your leg.
There is a normal build, and an experimental one. Roughly every two weeks, all the patches added to experimental is released to the normal build and the build number goes up by one. Currently waiting on build 21.

What I mean by building stuff is great if you are innovative? Well...

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=470288120

A building project I did alone dubbed Project Racer. This was completed in less than 4 days inclusive of resource gathering.
The full thing can be viewed here

http://steamcommunity.com/app/332500/discussions/0/530645446305634897/

Also my base
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=487241226

You may check my guide under section 7. for building projects I have completed and am in the midst of making. Hopefully they might give you some ideas if you do intend to buy GRAV


Now for the cons.

The ultimate killer for this game IMO, the game requires at least 8GB RAM to play properly at the moment. You can disable all the graphic options to enable GRAV to run at 4GB but thats the very bottomline it can go for now. This basically means unless you are using a custom laptop / high end one. You will not be able to play GRAV on a laptop.

Like a few other reviews have mentioned. There isnt much variety, Once you see a level 1 slime, you have seen the attack patterns for a level 60 slime as well. There are also NO headshot hitboxes in the game YET. I have personally confirmed with the developers they are adding this in, but no ETA on it yet. So what does all these mean? Basically PvE combat in this game boils down to kiting over and over again. But considering its early access and they are planning to release more content for combat its excusable... at least for me.

Currently the game has basically non-existent replayable end game content. But as you can probably see, the devs are starting to prepare and release stuff for that. Vehicles for upcomming warzones like the build 20 released hammerhead [ VTOL Jet ]. New monsters, stuff like that.

Insufficient playerbase is related to its somewhat bad start and also the lack of end game content. When more content is released, I do believe the playerbase will increase substainally. This game has alot of potiential and the devs are living up to it.

Resource farming on the other hand isnt as bad as some people made it sound. As with a majority of the cons, I have covered ways to make your life easier in the guide above.


The game is horribly optimised for large scale building projects atm. Patch 19 is supposed to fix quite alot of it but we will see.
EDIT
As of patch 19, Building large scale projects no longer lags the game to kingdom come. I now run at a pretty smooth 20 fps around my base. Previous was 9 - 15 FPS along with severe lag spikes. Do note that my base is HUGE and filled with dymanic base items like laser fences. I play with 30 - 60 FPS on other planets. This is with a custom laptop.
Another EDIT
Patch 20 further improves on building with serval optimizations and also introduces building decay into the game.

And.... griefers. This one is a major blow to the game. I will be upfront and say this. The PvE servers are even worse for griefing than the PvP ones. This is because a griefer can shoot your buildings and you cant even damage them while they are doing so on the PvE ones. They are planning fixes for this but I did not ask for an ETA for this [because there are ways to grief proof your buildings]. Also there are alot of stupid things that are done [e.g new player killing] by a small minority of jerk players... well you get my point. If you do intend to get this game I recommend you head to the offical server in your region with 01 in their name. For example, I am based in ASIA PvP 01. These servers normally have an active community that will help and look out for each other to keep the griefers away.

Building stuff, this one took me hours to learn. Once you learn how to utilise the system its easy, but before that its a pain in the *ahem* to do so. Just building a simple house with a single door to a balcony can drive you nuts when you are first starting to build stuff. I have covered how to use the system in the guide.

And so yeah, do I recommend this game?
If its on sales? Of course
At full price? Sure, I gotten more than my money back already.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you're reading these reviews, you're probably interested in GRAV.
Good.
Because this game deserves your interest.
In my 3 hours of playing this game, which is a Early Access title and is in a very early build, I can safely say that this is a game worth it's money.
Even being Early Access, the game offers amazing graphics, surprisingly in-depth crafting, base building, loot based combat and even enjoyable dungeon crawling.

It's too early to accurately review this game, but I will give you pros and cons from the perspective of an average gamer and consumer-

Pros:

1.Beautiful graphics (especially considering how early the current build is)
2.Loot based combat
3.In-depth crafting
4.Fun dungeon crawling
5.Coop

Cons:

1.Unoptimized (Even at it's lowest settings, my FX 8320 @ 4.2 GHz and GTX 660ti will dip down to 25 fps at times)
2.Harvesting resources can be VERY grindy
3.Blueprints and crafting could be explained better


Overall, the game is amazing when considering what it is. If you want to explore a beautiful alien world, battle through caves with your friends, or even build bases and craft by yourself, GRAV has you covered.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had high hopes for this game and realised quite quickly this game is nothing but a daily grind.

The setting is quite interesting and I quite like the graphics. Though after a while it gets quite boring as everything just looks the same.
There is no manipulation of the surroundings, no landscaping. All you can do is build certain devices and pre-factured containers. Wooden containers, stone containers, glass and metal (which you can't build unless you level a certain profession up, which takes forever...). No free building as you would be used to from other survival/mincraft genre-like games.
And these pre-factured blocks are the main problem. All items have a certain amount of degrading time (unfortunately usually quite short, something like 2 days). If you don't login over the weekend, you'll suddenly stand there without your house. The only way to keep them from degrading is to build a certain type of shield. This shield needs a generator. This generator needs wood. So what you basically do is logging in every day, grind wood to keep the generator and your shield going to keep the house from degrading. And this is literally your own purpose in this game.
Apparently there are more features, like claiming land which then makes you be able to claim tax from other players. But unfortunately, as blueprints need to drop from bosses, after 2 weeks of playing this game and basically mainly logging in, gathering wood for the generator and killing endless mobs outside and inside of caverns I didn't get anywhere.

As it is bad enough already, I played this game with my brother, so technically there was twice the manpower, twice the chance of dropping blueprints and you would suggest twice the fun. But it wasn't. We just both got annoyed really quick and as you might be able to see in my playing time in other games, I am usually not giving up that easily.

No quests, same monsters over and over again, random NPCs called Wei Wei the Wanderer" appearing wandering about and being killed by the monsters. Same with Vending Machine robots.

Unless you're an old-fashioned WoW grinding lover... you should avoid this game."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

>started game
>had no idea what to do
>wandered around until i made armor out of rotting wood
>built a gun
>feelprettygoodman.jpg
>entered cave
>found three people
>♥♥♥♥♥heysawme.wav
>they have no gear and they start waving at me
>they go around a fire and start dancing
>dance with them
>holy♥♥♥♥♥hisgameplaysdubstepmusicwhileyoudance.mp3
>dubstep music actually pretty good
>gets louder when more people dance at once
>we all form a team
>we leave the cave and make a base near another cave
>pretty good base so far
>we all explore for a while looking for stuff to kill
>find a base with 18 turrets massacreing everyone who comes near
>sees countless dead bodies
>everyone cheeses it like they've never cheesed before
>get back to base
>♥♥♥♥ around for 3 hours
>prime of my life
>everyone splits up suddenly
>i am the gorilla of the village now
>i let out a mighty gorilla roar
>this gorilla is now lonely
>this gorilla is now cry


420/911 would become gorilla again



In all seriousness though this is actually a pretty good game, it kinda reminds of a starbound+rust+mmo-ish hybrid type game ( cant really explain it better sorry ). You might want to play it with someone though as it could get a little boring by yourself, though it takes a while for that to happen. The graphics are really vibrant and juicy in this game, youll have to turn on post-processing though to really get these colors, but if you dont like post-processing effects, the colors will be a little washed out without it on. The only thing i dont like about this game is takes a while to get resources, or at least enough to build something good. Another thing about this game is that playing on high population servers might be a little annoying when youre trying to build a base and the crafting stations and such gets destroyed a lot when your offline, and building a turret to defend that stuff while your offline requiers a LOT of wood, which will take a while to get. One last thing i have to say about this game is that the landscares are gorgeous and have a true alien planet feel, which is different from most space type games out now.

Actual Review Score 8.5/10 - Its a VERY addicting game, even better with friends, though the grind may turn people away,and building a worthwhile base may be somewhat annoying with lots of other people around,although im sure the developers will improve on this sometime in the near future. For an early access game, this is one of the best, most content rich ones ive ever played.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has some of the usual EA problems but the foundation is rock solid and I have had a lot of fun in just my first couple play sessions.   Compared to many EA games this game has a lot of content and variety and the frame rate is smooth even on my mid tier rig.   The landscapes are gorgeous and the art style works with the music to produce some real immersion.

I enjoy PvP and so far I like what I see.  Gear and level is important but so are tactics and aim.  At level 4 I was able to scare off a level 19 just using the starter pistol when he had an assault rifle.    I was also attacked by a level 9 when I was level 7 and was able to down him mostly because I had better gear (had the better pistol at that point) so it's a good mix of skill and gear based victories.

The gunplay feels  a lot like Halo to me and I mean that in a good way.  It's arcadey but still feels like skill matters and accuracy while shooting on the run is critical and can be practiced.

The end game seems completely different then the beginning so I will update my review when I get to that but so far so good with Grav.  More people should be playing this game IMO it's highly polished and fun for an EA game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a good start for a good game.  However, in its current state, it is limited and buggy - as to be expected for early access.

The good:
Graphics
Combat
Exploration
Simplified resource gathering
Vehicles
Guns
Pets
Wide variety of items to craft
Classes with bonuses

The bad:
No real level progression*
Collision detection
Rarity of certain common resources*
Lack of base defense options
Lack of harvestable resource types
Lack of monster models
Very resource intensive
Small groups are ineffective*

The bad will probably be resolved, but a few really stick out.
*No real level progression: Sure your classes can level up and you can create new weapons and armor.  However, it doesn't matter.  All weapons are level based damage.  This means if you give a level 1 character the max level weaponry, they will still hit mobs that are only one level above them for minimal damage.  This is not apparent at lower levels, but after one reaches level 20 or so, it is an obvious pattern.  Bosses that used to be challenging turn into a huge time and ammo sink instead of being fun.

*Rarity of certain common resources: There are a ton of resources in this game.  However, you will run into a brick wall for one or two of them that are extremely rare - even though they are marked as common.  These resources will be staples to your progression and will basically stop it until you run around gather the 1 or two around the entire planet for a few hours.  But even then - when you do build that upgraded equipment, it won't have a noticeable change on combat.

*Small groups are ineffective: If you want to play this with 1 or two of your friends, it will be fun for the first few hours.  However, after level 20 or so, the no real level progression" portion kicks in.  If you find a loot chest or an artifact
date: you're either going to waste all of your ore on ammo or fail to get the artifact.\n\nAll in all
recommended: it is worth a try.  I liked the game for a while.  However
hoursPlayed: the bad points really ruined it.  Hopefully these get resolved."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played a significant amount of survival games. DayZ, Rust and Nether have been the dominant 3 for me. So far (I know it is early) Grav has all 3 beat. It seems like the dev(s) haved played all of these games as well and has corrected mistakes that the others have made. Here are a few benefits of choosing Grav over the rest.

- Penalty for dying isn't ridiculously brutal. Sure you go back to level 0 and lose some of your stuff but you keep the important stuff and get a shot at retrieving your lost goods from the spot where you kicked the bucket.

- Playing with friends. Rust and DayZ had me spending the entire time searching for my buddy so we could go.. survive. Grav has you build a Locator which gives you your lat/long. After building the Locator you never lose it. That's great.

- Food bar. No mare having to go somewhere and do the pointless activity of sitting and eating. You must collect food but eating is a passive feature.

- Traversing. Your dude moves swiftly and jumps and dances like no aliens are watching.

- Low-level areas are not overly punishing and aliens drop health. Tired of grinding in these survival games for an hour or so to start only to die and have to start over with this cycle repeating itself? Grav allows you to get going and keep going and progressing relatively easily unless you are KOS by another player which brings me to...

- The community is not full of KOS ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. At least not from my experience.

Another thing I dig about Grav is while playing it, I feel like I'm in a really cool 80's space-flick. Not sure if the devs meant this but I definitely get this vibe. The music and dancing is great as well. This game is basically the MMO survival version of Planet Explorers with Unreal Engine 4 behind it.

My beef at this point is only with the lag. Lag at this point makes the game unplayable at times. It's very early access so I'll give them a break for now but that needs to be priority 1. The UI is god awful as well but you can tell it is just placeholder stuff that will soon change so no biggie.

Other than that I hope they fix the lag and focus on keeping the hackers at bay and we will have ourselves a winner.

**update 3/5** Game is currently dead. Maybe due to stability issues or lack of end game, people are likely waiting for bigger updates to hit the game before logging back in. Keep this in mind if you plan on purchasing at this time**

**Update 4/7** The devs have released some big updates and the game is coming along wonderfully. People are beginning to trickle back in. No reason at this point to not have confidense in the team behind this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW

22 hours was played thus far on a PVE server

I will start off with the negatives, if you don't like the look of any of these, stay away and come back later. If not keep on reading.
Lag issues:
-Lag is still an issue right as of now but the dev is working on it and commited to fixing it right now. A special test server is up and a patch has already helped part of the issue but there is still a way to go.

Somewhat barebones:
-You can't take down the stuff you build at the moment (well in PVE, I havn't played on a PVP server so I can't tell if it's PVE related only).
-No clear friendslist you have to make parties with custom codes and key commands.
-Inventory system is minimal and missing features like displaying the look/picture of an item when selected.

The Positives!
Alright still here? Good because what is there is really enjoyable. Did you see all the stuff in the trailer? You can do all of it (well ok 90%) at this very moment! (unlike StarForge *angryface*) You can level up to max level (30) and gear up accordingly. You can play co-op with friends and run dungeons and fight bosses together (or alone you Einzelganger you). You can build really neat bases, craft armor, weapons and yes working vehicles and jetpacks. The graphics are bright and the colorscheme is nice. The aesthetic has it's very unique, silly and somewhat cutesy personality.

All in all it's impressive how complete the game already feels for a 6 month old project and there is a lot of fun to be had already. If the developers keep this up this will be a fantastic game. But you do have to realise there is still work to be done. You must understand this is still an Early Access game (in alpha). So things will break, bugs will annoy you (and I'm not only talking about the enemies)  and stuff will be missing.

Give the trailer another go! Does it look apealing? Yes? Don't you mind alpha/beta testing? And do you want to add to the development of the game? Join in have a blast. (playing with friends recommended, game may be addicting)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me preface this by saying this game does have a lot of potential.  I have put quite a few hours in it, and in the beginning it was quite enjoyable.   Lets look at the good AND the bad.

Good
1. Graphics are quite nice.  The style is unique and pretty.
2. The crafting system is fairly robust.
3. Good music and sounds when they aren't bugged.
4. The IDEA behind the game is sound, if realized I may recommend this game.

Bad
1.  This has improved slightly, but this is still the most poorly optimized game I've ever seen.
2.  The sound is bugged badly since release, hasn't improved at all.  Random sounds and music at random times.
3.  This is FALSELY advertised as both Single-Player AND Survival.  It is neither of those.
4.  A better name for the game could be Grindy McGrinderson lands on the planet Grind and builds Grindytown.
5.  It literally seems to get worse with each patch.  Sounds have gotten worse, the events are no more than large groups of random mobs (unless you get slimes, then you might see some bosses), the resource placement is appallingly bad right now, and the instances are scarce and nearly useless.
6.  To call combat rudimentary would be generous. Imagine Minecraft combat, only not as intricate.

The game IS an EA title as some will surely point out.  This MAY all get ironed out by release, but I don't recommend games on what they might be.  At this state is not really worth $10, much less $20.     Do yourself a favor and let them sort out this mess, don't toss your money away just yet.
